title: Hopewell Culture National Historical Park: Plants
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Nature     Plants               Plants          The 1,170 acres at Hopewell Culture National Historical Park is a mix of woodlands, riparian areas, prairie, fallow fields, mowed grass, and wetlands. There are approximately 462 species of plants found throughout the park, with diligent and observant volunteers and staff discovering more species each year.  Â    View the Vascular Plants Species List for the park.
